channel.title: Router help please
channel.description:
okay so, i have an WIRELESS AT&T CARD [img]http://connect.cmich.edu/images/devices/device102.jpg[/img]
i now have a router, when i connect with a router. it says UNIDENTIFIED NETWORK, and i also dont have a modem. any help?

item.title: Router help please
item.dc:creator: @mandood77 mandood77
item.description:
@mandood77 wrote:

[quote=“ghdork, post:10, topic:302392”][quote author=mandood77 link=topic=398715.msg2958449#msg2958449 date=1252981856]

[quote author=ghdork link=topic=398715.msg2958445#msg2958445 date=1252981733]

Why are you running your internet off a flash drive?
[/quote]… forqua, ok ummm, you used your own money to buy a router for your server? now on to topic, are there any ISP’s that have cable/dsl or somthin, once you get a modem from them, your server would work, because this also has to be server releated!

only thing available in my area
is there a way to do this or not?
i have a router and everything
[/quote] wait wait wait! ok so let me get this straight, is your flash drive connected to your router by any chance?

no, its in my PC USB port

i have a router
i have that USB internet thing i stated at first post
nothing else. can i run a server or not?[/quote] Unless your stick has a way of connecting to the router, i can’t help you

Read full topic

is there a way to do this or not?

no, its in my PC USB port

[/quote][/quote]

i have a router
i have that USB internet thing i stated at first post
nothing else. can i run a server or not?

item.title: Router help please
item.dc:creator: @ghdork ghdork
item.description:
@ghdork wrote:

r34p4g3pk:

Is your wireless FD set-up and or installed, if not it may not be able to find local networks, plus if you connect to other ip’s with that, they will have to port forward, that’s really a waste of money.

it’s installed, i pay for it myself, independant connection.
no one can connect through it or vice versa[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 14, 2009, 08:17:40 pm[/size][hr][quote=“mandood77, post:3, topic:302392”]if the internet is connected to the router, than use an adaptor for the router to connect to your whatever you have[/quote]

but my internet is a USB
i have an ethernet from PC to router
nothing else[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 14, 2009, 08:21:06 pm[/size][hr]HELP?

Read full topic

item.title: Router help please
item.dc:creator: @mandood77 mandood77
item.description:
@mandood77 wrote:

if the internet is connected to the router, than use an adaptor for the router to connect to your whatever you have

item.title: Router help please

item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Is your wireless FD set-up and or installed, if not it may not be able to find local networks, plus if you connect to other ip’s with that, they will have to port forward, that’s really a waste of money.
